title: How Will College Admissions Change if Affirmative Action is Overturned?
description: Two “race-neutral alternatives” are frequently proposed: a search for socioeconomic diversity, which is often a proxy for racial and ethnic diversity, and a plan to admit the top candidates from every high school, while trying to expand recruitment.
dc:creator: Anemona Hartocollis
media:description: Demonstrators supporting Harvard’s admission policy in Cambridge, Mass., in 2018.
